other_tests.findings: T2 hyperintense signal around the gallbladder fossa with subtle parenchymal hyperemia; moderate signal drop on out of phase imaging consistent with hepatic steatosis (fat fraction 17%); gallbladder notable for cholelithiasis and sludge; mildly dilated gallbladder with heterogenous enhancement and mild pericholecystic free fluid with gallbladder wall edema.
Signs of gallbladder inflammation and edema.
Thickened gallbladder wall, multiple gallstones, and a positive sonographic Murphy's sign.
